Title: ‚ÄúSign Language Talk‚Äù Using Machine Learning
Abstract: people with special needs frequently experience hearing loss which impacts many parts of their lives and prevents them from interacting socially and communicating with others efficiently. the community of people who are speech impaired use sign languages as their native tongues and have complete access to communication. hand gestures are used in sign language to convey the intended meaning of people with specific communication needs to the outside world. this project proposes ‚äúsign language talk‚äù a machine learning based sign language to speech system that will assist people in improving their communication skills. it helps in the conversion of real time sign language image input to text and speech which allows communication between speech impaired people and normal people. the speaker output helps to understand this sign language to visually impaired people too. the project is implemented on convolutional neural network  cnn  using python tools which takes input through the camera and compares it with a pre loaded indian sign language  isl  dataset and generates text output on the screen as well as speech output through speakers. the parameters such as accuracy precision and recall were taken into consideration for evaluating the project. during the training of the model accuracy was obtained to be 100%. the accuracy outcome with the project in runtime was observed to be 87%. the software can also be used for educational purposes in practicing sign language in schools of speech impaired students.
